intro: Hemiandra, commonly known as the mountain pepper or mountain hibiscus, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is native to Australia and includes several species that are typically shrubs or small trees. The plants are characterized by their showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. Hemiandra species often have rough, hairy leaves and produce small, capsule-like fruits. They are adapted to grow in a variety of habitats, including rocky soils and mountainous regions.
